titles.ar: بَابُ مَا يَجِبُ فِيهِ الْفِدَاءُ مِنْ لُبْسِ الثِّيَابِ
titles.en: Chapter 87 – What Obligates the expiation, from wearing the clothes

titles.ar: بَابُ الرَّجُلِ يُحْرِمُ فِي قَمِيصٍ أَوْ يَلْبَسُهُ بَعْدَ مَا يُحْرِمُ
titles.en: Chapter 88 – The man wear Ihraam in a shirt, or he wears it after wearing Ihraam

titles.ar: بَابُ الْمُحْرِمِ يُضْطَرُّ إِلَى مَا لَا يَجُوزُ لَهُ لُبْسُهُ
titles.en: Chapter 86 – The one in Ihraam is desperate to what is not allowed for him to wear

titles.ar: بَابُ مَا يَجِبُ فِيهِ الْفِدَاءُ مِنْ لُبْسِ الثِّيَابِ
titles.en: Chapter 87 – What Obligates the expiation, from wearing the clothes

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/297)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ وَ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ لَبِسَ ثَوْباً لَا يَنْبَغِي لَهُ لُبْسُهُ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ فَفَعَلَ ذَلِكَ نَاسِياً أَوْ سَاهِياً أَوْ جَاهِلًا فَلَا شَيْ‏ءَ عَلَيْهِ وَ مَنْ فَعَلَهُ مُتَعَمِّداً فَعَلَيْهِ دَمٌ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, and Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Ali Bin Raib, from Zurara,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’farasws having said: ‘The one who wear clothes which are not befitting for him to wear while he is in Ihraam, so he does that out of forgetfulness, or mistake, or ignorance, so there is nothing upon him; but the one who does that deliberately, so upon him is blood (of a slaughtered animal)’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad and Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from Ali ibn Ri’ab from Zurarah who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘If one in the state of Ihram wears a cloth which he is not supposed to wear and one does it out of forgetfulness, ignorance or by mistake, there is not anything on him; but if one does it knowingly, one must offer an offering animal.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/298)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا ( عليهما السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ ضُرُوبٍ مِنَ الثِّيَابِ مُخْتَلِفَةٍ يَلْبَسُهَا الْمُحْرِمُ إِذَا احْتَاجَ مَا عَلَيْهِ قَالَ لِكُلِّ صِنْفٍ مِنْهَا فِدَاءٌ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Hammad, from Hareyz, from Muhammad Bin Muslim,

(It has been narrated) from one of the two (5th or 6th Imamasws), said, ‘I asked himasws about the variety of different clothes which the one in Ihraam wears when he needs. What is upon him?’ Heasws said: ‘For every type from it, is an expiation’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Hammad from Hariz, from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once asked one of the two Imam, (abu Ja’far or abu ‘Abd Allah), ‘Alayhim al-Salam, about one’s wearing different kinds of clothes in the state of Ihram, if needed. He (the Imam) said, ‘For wearing every kind there is ransom to pay.’”
